title: What if cracks in concrete could fix themselves? - Congrui Jin

multiple-choice.question: What is the main weakness of concrete as a construction material?

options.label: C
options.text: It is not strong enough to support tall buildings.

options.text: It is not durable enough to withstand natural disasters.

multiple-choice.question: What is the process called when cement forms a paste and coats the aggregates, quickly hardening through a chemical reaction?

options.label: A
options.text: Hydration

options.label: B
options.text: Autogenous healing

options.label: C
options.text: Concrete shrinkage

options.label: D
options.text: Crystallization

options.label: A
options.text: Autogenous healing

options.label: B
options.text: Hydration

options.label: C
options.text: Concrete shrinkage

options.label: D
options.text: Crystallization

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: By using a special type of cement that is resistant to cracking.

options.label: D
options.text: By applying a sealant to the surface of the concrete.

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: Vultures: The acid-puking, plague-busting heroes of the ecosystem - Kenny Coogan

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about the stomachs of vultures, particularly the mountain-dwelling bearded vulture?

options.label: A
options.text: They have the highest gastric pH in the animal kingdom.

options.label: B
options.text: They can digest most bones in just 24 hours.

options.label: C
options.text: They can only consume fresh meat.

options.label: D
options.text: They are susceptible to diseases like cholera and anthrax.

multiple-choice.question: Why are vultures important to the ecosystem, especially in regions where they are present?

options.label: B
options.text: They contaminate drinking water with their waste.

options.label: C

options.label: A
options.text: Habitat loss and fragmentation.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Poaching and hunting.

options.label: D
options.text: Climate change.

options.label: A
options.text: Carcasses take longer to decay, contaminating drinking water.

options.label: B
options.text: Feral dogs and rats carry diseases into human communities.

options.label: C
options.text: The ecosystem becomes more balanced.

options.label: D
options.text: Both A and B.

multiple-choice.question: What is being done to conserve vulture populations, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: Conservationists are working to repopulate vulture communities through breeding programs.

options.label: B
options.text: Researchers are studying the behavior of vultures to better understand their role in the ecosystem.

options.label: C
options.text: Communities are opening vulture restaurants where farmers safely dispose of drug-free livestock.

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above.

options.label: B
options.text: It is a way to symbolize the cutting of corn in the fields and to feed the gods.

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: It is a way to protect the community from evil spirits.

title: Why are earthquakes so hard to predict? - Jean-Baptiste P. Koehl

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.text: Seismometers are not accurate enough.

options.label: C

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: What is the ultimate goal of earthquake prediction research?

options.text: To track and predict large-scale geological changes in real time.

options.label: C
options.text: To detect earthquakes as they happen.

options.label: D
options.text: To provide a detailed warning system for incoming quakes.

options.text: They disguised the children as non-Jewish orphans.

options.label: C
options.text: They bundled the children into dirty laundry, packed them into boxes on cargo trains, and carried them in coffins, toolboxes, and briefcases.

options.label: D
options.text: They bribed Nazi officials to let the children leave.
